condition.description:
The stomach is an organ between the esophagus and the small intestine. It mixes food with stomach acid and helps digest protein. Stomach cancer mostly affects older people - two-thirds of people who have it are over age 65. Your risk of getting it is also higher if you

  • Have had a Helicobacter pylori infection
  • Have had stomach inflammation
  • Are a man
  • Eat lots of salted, smoked, or pickled foods
  • Smoke cigarettes
  • Have a family history of stomach cancer

It is hard to diagnose stomach cancer in its early stages. Indigestion and stomach discomfort can be symptoms of early cancer, but other problems can cause the same symptoms. In advanced cases, there may be blood in your stool, vomiting, unexplained weight loss, jaundice, or trouble swallowing. Doctors diagnose stomach cancer with a physical exam, blood and imaging tests, an endoscopy, and a biopsy.

Because it is often found late, it can be hard to treat stomach cancer. Treatment options include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation or a combination.

NIH: National Cancer Institute
condition.name: Stomach cancer

carousel_items: Herceptin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the infusion. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure, difficulty breathing, or swelling usually happen within the first 24 hours.
Can cause heart problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have shortness of breath (especially at night), swelling in your arms or legs, or a cough that's new or worse.
Can cause lung problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have trouble breathing, shortness of breath, or a cough that's new or worse.
Only used for specific types of breast and stomach cancer. You'll have to take a test first to determine if Herceptin is the right medicine for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Herceptin is a monoclonal antibody. It stops tumor growth by inhibiting a specific protein in cancer cells.
basics.bottom_line: Herceptin is an effective, first-line option when used together with other medicines for certain types of breast and stomach cancers, but it has many side effects and needs a lot of monitoring.
downsides: Not the best choice if you have heart, kidney, or lung problems.
Your heart function will have to be checked regularly while you're taking Herceptin. This will be done before, during, and after treatment.

Herceptin can cause birth defects. Birth control is recommended while you're taking Herceptin and for 6 months after you finish. Talk to your doctor before starting Herceptin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice if you have heart, kidney, or lung problems.
Your heart function will have to be checked regularly while you're taking Herceptin. This will be done before, during, and after treatment.

Herceptin can cause birth defects. Birth control is recommended while you're taking Herceptin and for 6 months after you finish. Talk to your doctor before starting Herceptin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

upsides: Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can improve response and lower relapse in people with a certain type of breast cancer.
Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can increase the chance of living longer in people with a certain type of stomach cancer.
Treats breast and stomach cancer in people whose tumor has an excess of a specific protein (HER2).
First-line treatment option when used with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines for certain metastatic breast and stomach cancers.

upsides_processed.orig: Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can improve response and lower relapse in people with a certain type of breast cancer.
Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can increase the chance of living longer in people with a certain type of stomach cancer.
Treats breast and stomach cancer in people whose tumor has an excess of a specific protein (HER2).
First-line treatment option when used with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines for certain metastatic breast and stomach cancers.

drugs.name: Herceptin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Herceptin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the infusion. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure, difficulty breathing, or swelling usually happen within the first 24 hours.
Can cause heart problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have shortness of breath (especially at night), swelling in your arms or legs, or a cough that's new or worse.
Can cause lung problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have trouble breathing, shortness of breath, or a cough that's new or worse.
Only used for specific types of breast and stomach cancer. You'll have to take a test first to determine if Herceptin is the right medicine for you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin can increase your risk of heart failure. Heart tests may be required before starting treatment, during treatment, and after finishing treatment.

description_processed.orig: Herceptin can increase your risk of heart failure. Heart tests may be required before starting treatment, during treatment, and after finishing treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin has been reported to cause serious and deadly infusion reactions and lung damage. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure or difficulty breathing, usually occur within 24 hours of receiving Herceptin. Your doctor may consider stopping Herceptin if you develop hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing), angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (lung condition that lowers oxygen in the blood).

description_processed.orig: Herceptin has been reported to cause serious and deadly infusion reactions and lung damage. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure or difficulty breathing, usually occur within 24 hours of receiving Herceptin. Your doctor may consider stopping Herceptin if you develop hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing), angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (lung condition that lowers oxygen in the blood).

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin may cause birth defects or death to a fetus. Don't use Herceptin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Herceptin may cause birth defects or death to a fetus. Don't use Herceptin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Herceptin can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Herceptin can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.
